thread.title: How do Love Field, D/FW Airport stack up for affordability?
thread.title_full: How do Love Field, D/FW Airport stack up for affordability?

author: Olivia Pulsinelli
title: How do Love Field, D/FW Airport stack up for affordability?
text:
Sergiy Trofimov One Texas airport cracked the top five on Cheapflights.com’s Sixth Annual Airport… more Dallas Love Field has moved up in the rankings on Cheapflights.com’s Sixth Annual Airport Affordability Index . The list is based on airports’ average airfares to a variety of popular domestic and international destinations that travelers found on Cheapflights.com during the month of June. The ranking includes 101 airports. The top spot among Texas airports goes to Dallas Love Field (DAL), which moved up one spot from the 2014 list to take the No. 3 spot. Dallas Love Field’s average airfare for June was $251, tying with New York’s La Guardia (LGA). Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International (CVG) ranks No. 1 with $199, Atlanta International (ATL) is No. 2 with $231, and Chicago-O’Hare International rounds out the top five with $265. Austin came in at No. 16 with an average airfare of $293, moving up an impressive 38 spots on the list. Cheapflights acknowledged there was a lot of movement throughout the list — of the top five airports, all except DAL ranked below No. 30 last year. Many of the top-ranked airports recently have seen an upswing in passenger seats by discount airlines, a statement from the website notes. Here is how the rest of the Texas airports ranked on the list, based on their average airfare for June on Cheapflights.com: No. 29: Dallas/Fort Worth International, TX (DFW), $332 No. 32: William P. Hobby, TX (HOU), $337 No. 41: George Bush Intercontinental, TX (IAH), $356 No. 71: San Antonio International, TX (SAT), $434 No. 95: El Paso International, TX (ELP), $554
